addFeeTier(uint24).details: Will revert if the provided fee tier is not supported by Uniswap V3

canSupportPair(address,address).details: _tokenA and _tokenB may be passed in either tokenA/tokenB or tokenB/tokenA order

params._tokenB: The other of the pair's tokens

returns._0: Whether the given pair of tokens can be supported by the oracle

poolsUsedForPair(address,address).details: _tokenA and _tokenB may be passed in either tokenA/tokenB or tokenB/tokenA order

returns._usedPools: An array with all pools used for quoting the given pair

params._amountIn: The amount that will be provided
params._tokenIn: The token that will be provided
params._tokenOut: The token we would like to quote

returns._amountOut: How much _tokenOut will be returned in exchange for _amountIn amount of _tokenIn

setPeriod(uint16).details: Will revert it is lower than MINIMUM_PERIOD or greater than MAXIMUM_PERIOD WARNING: increasing the period could cause big problems, because Uniswap V3 pools might not support a TWAP so old.

returns._feeTiers: An array of all supported fee tiers

MINIMUM_LIQUIDITY_THRESHOLD.details: This check is only performed when adding support for a pair. If the pool's liquidity then goes below the threshold, then it will still be used for the quote calculation

period.return: _period The period used for the TWAP

AddedFeeTier(uint24).notice: Emitted when a new fee tier is added

AddedSupportForPair(address,address).notice: Emitted when the oracle add supports for a new pair

PeriodChanged(uint32).notice: Emitted when a new period is set

MINIMUM_LIQUIDITY_THRESHOLD().notice: Returns the minimum liquidity that a pool needs to have in order to be used for a pair's quote

addFeeTier(uint24).notice: Adds support for a new Uniswap V3 fee tier

addSupportForPair(address,address).notice: This function will take a pair and make sure that all Uniswap V3 pools for the pair are properly initialized for future use. It will also add all available pools to an internal list, to avoid future queries to the factory. It can be called multiple times for the same pair of tokens, to include and re-configure new pools that might appear in the future. Will revert if there are no pools available for the given pair of tokens.

canSupportPair(address,address).notice: Returns whether this oracle can support this pair of tokens

period().notice: Returns the period used for the TWAP calculation

poolsUsedForPair(address,address).notice: Returns a list of all Uniswap V3 pools used for a given pair

quote(address,uint128,address).notice: Returns a quote, based on the given tokens and amount

setPeriod(uint16).notice: Sets the period to be used for the TWAP calculation

supportedFeeTiers().notice: Returns a list of all supported Uniswap V3 fee tiers
